dataSpace.title: Catena-X Dataspace
dataSpace.description: The base concept of catena-x is the data exchange in a standardized format. This is reached by data sovereignty (explanation needed) and interoperability (link needed). Via data policies you can decide who can access data offers on several different levels

sections.title: Policy Intro
sections.description: Policies are used to define data access policies as well as usage details.<1></1><1></1>Access means it defined who can access / see and request data offers. Usage defines the data ussage after the data are accessible. E.g. Company A can access vehicle data of company B but is only allowed to use them for manufacturing reasons and not marketing content<1></1><1></1>The following page provides details about the following access policies<1></1><1></1>* <2>BPN</2><1></1>* <2>Use Case</2><1></1>* <2>Role</2><1></1>

sections.title: Data Access policy based on Business Partner Number
sections.description: The business partner number (every member of catena-x has ist own bpn) can be used to restrict data access.<1></1><1></1>Means, company a can define that company b is allowed to see/access a data contract while company c isnt.<1></1><1></1>While creating a data offer, company a needs to decide if the data offer is restricted for a number of companys (bpns) or not<1></1>>> List of Business Partners [link]<1></1>>> BPDM Use case details (coming soon)
